meanings.definition: A person who pretends to be someone else in order to deceive others.
meanings.sent1: The impostors tried to trick the villagers with their disguises.
meanings.sent2: The detective uncovered the impostors posing as wealthy businessmen.
meanings.sent3: The impostors at the costume party were revealed when their masks fell off.
meanings.sent4: The impostors in the play were so convincing that the audience gasped in surprise.
meanings.sent5: Beware of impostors pretending to be your friends; they may have ulterior motives.

meanings.definition: Something that deceives by presenting a false appearance.
meanings.sent1: The shiny object turned out to be an impostor, not real gold.
meanings.sent2: The online advertisement was an impostor, promising a free vacation but leading to a scam.
meanings.sent3: The cake that looked like a real book was an impostor dessert at the party.
meanings.sent4: The impostor cloud in the sky turned out to be a cleverly shaped balloon.
meanings.sent5: The impostor gemstone sparkled deceptively, fooling many into thinking it was genuine.
